page.title: 20Housing in Hebden Bridge
page.content: Hebden Bridge is a valley town in the Pennines. The valley sides are steep and much of the housing is built on the hillsides. As a former mill town most of the houses are between one and two hundred years old and are of the terrace type. There is of course a variety of dwellings including detached, semi-detached, bungalows, farmhouses on the hilltops, and flats. The most interesting is the{double {decker terrace type house}built in the valley sides. One side of the terrace has three or four storeys while the other may have only two or three storeys with one family living at the front and another family living in the rear house. Access to these houses is by a road to the front and a lane or "ginnel" at the back. Some of these roads still have stone 'setts' or cobbles dating back to the 19th cent.
